miic.core.miic_utils.corr_check¶

corr_check(corr_fun_struct)[source]¶

Correlation function dictionary check

This function test if the a loaded correlation function dictionary contains the requested keywords and if their corresponding value is of the proper class to continue the processing, e.g., recombining then to form a correlation matrix.

Actually the requested keywords are:
‘corr_trace’ (not for the old_style corr_fun) ‘stats’ ‘stats_tr1’ ‘stats_tr2’

and their class is, for all of them, numpy.ndarray. The three “stats” objects are also checked for some “main” errors like the starttime greather then the endtime or a substaintial (greater then 1 sample) disagreement between starttime, endtime, sampling_rate and npts.

Parameters:corr_fun_struct (dict) – Correlation function dictionary
Return type:dict
Returns:ret_dict: dictionary that contains the following keys: is_incomplete: True if a keyword is missed missed_keys: list of missed keywords wrong_class: list of keyworkds which value is of a wrong class ERROR_stats: list of errors (strings) detected in the ‘stats’ object ERROR_stats_tr1: list of errors (strings) detected in the
‘stats_tr1’ object
ERROR_stats_tr2*: list of errors (strings) detected in the
‘stats_tr2’ object

... rubric:: Notes

If the correlation function have been saved to a matlab file and than reloaded, it is supposed that the stats onìbjects have been flattened. For instance, this can be achieved doing the reload with the function mat_to_ndarray() setting the flag flatten to True (this is the default value)
